title: Milk Measurement
statement:
# Milk Measurement

Farmer John tracks the milk production of his three cows over time.

## Problem Description

Farmer John has exactly 3 cows: Bessie, Elsie, and Mildred. Initially, each cow produces 7 gallons of milk per day.

Over time, the milk production changes. You are given N changes, where each change specifies a cow and the change in her daily milk production (which can be positive or negative).

The cows compete for the "best milker" title displayed on the barn wall. A cow earns a spot on the wall if she produces the most milk (ties are allowed). 

Count how many times the display on the barn wall needs to change. The initial state (all three cows tied) counts as the starting display.

## Input Format

The first line contains N.
The next N lines each contain a day number, cow name, and change amount.

## Output Format

The number of times the display changes.

## Constraints

- 1 ≤ N ≤ 100
- Cow names are: Bessie, Elsie, Mildred
- -100 ≤ change ≤ 100
